definition: (name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out

sentences.english: We read some, and mean to every day, " they all cried in chorus .
sentences.chinese: 我们读了一点，以后每天都要读，“姐妹们齐声喊道。

sentences.english: Sing the song《I'm a little teacher. 》together.
sentences.chinese: 齐唱歌曲教师要求学生伴随录音齐声歌曲。

sentences.english: I want a chorus in the answer here.
Democracy is when all of God's children sing together.
sentences.chinese: 孩童齐声歌唱时，民主即在其中。

sentences.english: The crowd chorused their approval of the decision.
sentences.chinese: 群众对该决定齐声表示赞同。
孩子们在欢快地齐声唱歌。

sentences.english: All the best , " called the other typists in chorus."
sentences.chinese: “祝万事如意，”其他打字员齐声喊道。

sentences.english: A flock of birds was already warbling a cheerful morning chorus.
sentences.chinese: 一群鸟儿已经齐声唱起了欢快的晨曲。

sentences.english: Eg. The birds were chorusing around us.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿在我们周围齐声歌唱。

sentences.english: "There are no unit tests," we chorused.
Finally, all civil and military officials in the court held high wine glasses to congratulate on Emperor Xuanzong birthday.
sentences.chinese: 最后朝中文武百官高举酒杯齐声为玄宗祝寿。

sentences.english: These fireflies even twinkled with their friends of the same kind at the neighboring tree, singing in chorus.
sentences.chinese: 这些萤火虫也照亮了附近的树木，齐声高唱。

sentences.english: Tens of thousands of fans greeted the squad, chanting “we do not regret the love.”
sentences.chinese: 成千上万球迷前来迎接，齐声高唱“爱你无悔”。

sentences.english: The students chorused their approval of the suggestion.
sentences.chinese: 同学们对该建议齐声表示赞成。

sentences.english: All the wrestlers and eunuchs present applauded enthusiastically.
sentences.chinese: 众武士和太监齐声喝采。

sentences.english: Jackals cry in chorus from the courtyard of the deserted house in the light of the worn-out moon.
sentences.chinese: 疲惫的月光中，豺狼在被废弃的院落中齐声嗥叫。

definition: different mouths, same voice/to speak in unison (idiom)
to promise/to agree to do sth
very loudly/at the top of one's voice
to follow your orders/to do as you bid
Long live (the king, the revolution etc)!/Your Majesty/His Majesty
to shout an order or command
to shout loudly/to raise a cry/to yell
